roleset.name: temper (strengthen), and possibly attach, by heating and cooling
roleset.note: ANNEAL-V, ANNEALING-N NOTES: Added by Julia for Biotexts.

role.descr: adhered to, as a result of melting and hardening

example.name: anneal-v
example.text: In this paper, [the carbon nitride films]-1 were synthesized by vacuum cathodic arc method and then annealed *-1 at different temperature up to about 600 °C.
example.arg: at different temperature up to about 600 °C.

example.name: anneal-v
example.text: If you don't anneal the glass then you are producing a walking time-bomb: I knew someone who had had a paperweight for ten years, and then one sunny day it simply went off, exploding and spraying shards of glass all over his living room.

example.name: anneal-v: with arg5, trigger warning for fiery car accident
example.text: And most cars now a days, well, the air bag will act like Saran Wrap and, as it has melted from the flames, anneal itself to the biological remains of the driver, and preserve up to 72 percent for transplantation.
example.arg: as it has melted from the flames
to the biological remains of the driver

example.name: anneal-v: with arg4
example.text: This means that the rocks are hotter than normal rocks that are being deformed by say mountian building events and so the fualts break and fracture and then some of them basically anneal shut again - the fracture heals its self or the rock sort of glues itself back together again.

example.name: alias-v: DNA
example.text: A series of steps catalyzed in part by the recombinase then leads to joining of the two helices by at least one Holliday junction , in which-1 [a segment of a single strand in each helix]-2 is annealed *-2 to the complementary strand in the other helix *-1.
example.arg: to the complementary strand in the other helix
